comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: This is a Henri Farman HF-22. There were two "brands" if you will of Farman aircraft, those known by the HF (Henri Farman) series of pusher aircraft, and the MF (Maurice Farman) types of pusher aircraft used by the Allies in WWI. This is one of the former. Later they were known by simply Farman, but at this particular time, 1913-1915, these were known by their designers' initials... HF for Henri Farman, and MF for Maurice Farman.

comment.author: 87404306@N07
comment._content: I think it is HF-20/ HF-22 take other construction of landing gear.
